channel.title: A Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content on A Hugo website

item.title: O notation depends on what limit you're taking
item.description: Something that confused me about \(O\) notation differences between algorithms and calculus. The notation provides a convenient way of describing the limit of a function \(f(x)\) as \(x\) approaches a specific limit.. This limit is different between a standard algorithms and calculus course. In algorithms \(x \to \infty\) while in calculus \(x \to 0\). For example we have in algorithms: \[x^2 + x = O(x^2)\quad x \to \infty\] since

item.title: Calculating the determinent of an equicovariance matrix
item.description: The goal is to find the determinant by re-writing \(\Sigma\) as a upper triangular matrix. Then [[Determinant of triangular matrix is the product of the diagonal]] We add a new row and new column. Recall that the determinant can be defined recursively. Since the new matrix as a \(1\) in the \(\Sigma_{11}\) position, then the determinant remains the same. We aim to eliminate the original off diagonals. We need to remove the lower diagonal for obvious reasons.

item.title: Does convergence in measure imply convergence a.s.?
item.description: No in fact you can have measureable random in probability which also converge almost no where: We define \(X_i = [a,b] := X_i = I_{[0,1]}/(b-a)\) the indicator RV over \([0,1]\) normalized such that it integrates to 1. \[\begin{aligned} X_1 & = [0,1] \\ X_2, X_3 & = [0,1/2), [1/2,1] \\ X_4,X_5,X_6 & = [0,1/3), [1/3,2/3), [2/3,1] \\ \dots \end{aligned}\] That is we can imagine a box that is shrinking in width while increasing in height.

item.title: About
item.description: This is a “hello world” example website for the blogdown package. The theme was forked from @jrutheiser/hugo-lithium-theme and modified by Yihui Xie.
